com.gemstone.gemfire.cache

Interface TransactionWriter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CacheCallback

    public interface TransactionWriter
extends CacheCallback
    A callback that is allowed to veto a transaction. Only one TransactionWriter can exist per cache, and only one TransactionWriter will be fired in the entire distributed system for each transaction. This writer can be used to update a backend data source before the GemFire cache is updated during commit. If the backend update fails, the implementer can throw a TransactionWriterException to veto the transaction.
    Since:
    6.5
    See Also:
    CacheTransactionManager.setWriter(com.gemstone.gemfire.cache.TransactionWriter)

    • Method Detail

      • beforeCommit

        void beforeCommit(TransactionEvent event)
                  throws TransactionWriterException
        Called before the transaction has finished committing, but after conflict checking. Provides an opportunity for implementors to cause transaction abort by throwing a TransactionWriterException
        Parameters:
        event - the TransactionEvent
        Throws:
        TransactionWriterException - in the event that the transaction should be rolled back
        See Also:
        CacheTransactionManager.commit()
